summary: After watching Detective Pikachu, I’ve figured out why Tim lost interest in becoming a Pokémon Trainer.  In Tim’s flashback in...
body:
After watching Detective Pikachu, I’ve figured out why Tim lost interest in becoming a Pokémon Trainer. 

In Tim’s flashback in his room, he says it’s the most important day of his life, where he later learns of his mother’s death. He tells Pikachu later that his mother passed away when he was eleven. In the anime and manga, ten and eleven are the usual ages of when a kid starts their journey. 

This means Tim gave up becoming a Pokémon Trainer because the day he was going to become one was the day he lost his mother. This adds on when he feels his dad spent more time working and with Pokémon, thus pushing them away.

This means Tim gave up becoming a Pokémon Trainer because the day he was going to become one was the day he lost his mother. This adds on when he feels his dad spent more time working and with Pokémon, thus pushing them away.

summary: It's time for Detective Pikachu... I... Love it! ❤️ Omg! Everything was spot on! It was amazing. The animation was incredible,...
body: It’s time for Detective Pikachu… I… Love it! ❤️ Omg! Everything was spot on! It was amazing. The animation was incredible, unlike other video game movies cough cough sonic cough cough, I absolutely fell in love with every Pokémon that appeared in the movie. At first, I was a little bit skeptical about the whole Ryan Reynolds being Pikachu, I assumed Pikachu was going to have a sweet voice, and thought that Ryan didn’t quite fit. But oh God, I was so wrong. It made everything better, and I enjoyed my time on the theater so much. Even though I enjoyed this movie a lot, someone close to me said it was a dumb movie. I was about to slap that person, but I figured you might want to hear someone ranting about what they hated of this movie, so here you go, my friend’s opinion: to him, the movie lacked realism, the story was all over the place that didn’t make any sense or it was dumb, everything was rushed including the love story, and the whole theme of Pokémon was lost in this movie. Anyways, I really love this movie, but do you think my friend is right? Is this movie good or bad? 👀

tags: im disabled and it made me feel weird
summary: We saw Detective Pikachu today, and the whole plot was basically "rich white guy has internalized ableism and hates his really...
body:
We saw Detective Pikachu today, and the whole plot was basically “rich white guy has internalized ableism and hates his really cool and functional wheelchair so he decides to abuse Pokemon and for some reason wants to make people into Pokemon”. Like the fact that he’s in a wheelchair doesn’t even add to the story, it’s just a weird ableist trope that people don’t LIKE their wheelchairs. Wheelchairs are liberation, not confinement. They literally could have just made him a weird white guy that wanted to put Mew Two through more abuse than he’s already been through.

Idunno. I liked all of the Pokemon and the life with them, but the whole plot was just….. Not that great.

Like the fact that he’s in a wheelchair doesn’t even add to the story, it’s just a weird ableist trope that people don’t LIKE their wheelchairs. Wheelchairs are liberation, not confinement. They literally could have just made him a weird white guy that wanted to put Mew Two through more abuse than he’s already been through.

Idunno. I liked all of the Pokemon and the life with them, but the whole plot was just….. Not that great.

Like the fact that he’s in a wheelchair doesn’t even add to the story, it’s just a weird ableist trope that people don’t LIKE their wheelchairs. Wheelchairs are liberation, not confinement. They literally could have just made him a weird white guy that wanted to put Mew Two through more abuse than he’s already been through.

We saw Detective Pikachu today, and the whole plot was basically “rich white guy has internalized ableism and hates his really cool and functional wheelchair so he decides to abuse Pokemon and for some reason wants to make people into Pokemon”. Like the fact that he’s in a wheelchair doesn’t even add to the story, it’s just a weird ableist trope that people don’t LIKE their wheelchairs. Wheelchairs are liberation, not confinement. They literally could have just made him a weird white guy that wanted to put Mew Two through more abuse than he’s already been through.

Idunno. I liked all of the Pokemon and the life with them, but the whole plot was just….. Not that great.
